page.title: 14POPULATION -1
page.content: Since the block straddles two local government wards,(Preston Rural East and Chipping), these observations are based on two, somewhat differing, tables of statistics from the 1981 Census. As a sparsely-populated area(less than one person per hectare) and an area of marginally declining population, there is no overcrowding as dwelling sizes are larger than average. Family sizes tend to be about or slightly above the national average. The fertility index is lower than average as is the number of children of pre-school age. However, the number of children of school age in the Chipping section of the block is much higher than average. In the Preston Rural East section, there are fewer schoolchildren than the national average. In both areas there are relatively few pensioners, probably
